intro: Dyschoriste mutica, commonly known as the narrowleaf dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Dyschoriste mutica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a notable species within its native habitat.
